entries.meaning: A group of people organized for a common purpose.
examples: a work brigade; a fire brigade

entries.meaning: (military) Military unit composed of several regiments (or battalions) and including soldiers from different arms of service.
(derogatory) A group of people who share views or a specific characteristic.
examples: More sympathy for career criminals from the bleeding-heart brigade!
I wouldn't even want to be seen dead with those nerds of the bowl-cut brigade.

entries.meaning: (Internet slang) Coordinated online harassment, disruption or influencing, especially organized by an antagonistic website or community.

verbs.description: brigade (third-person singular simple present brigades, present participle brigading, simple past and past participle brigaded)

entries.meaning: To form or unite into a brigade; to group together.
examples: This is, however, a classic case where speech is brigaded with action.

entries.meaning: (Internet slang) To harass an individual or community online in a coordinated manner.
